What do you want out of Downtown Dakar?
utterance.kb: If you want out of the craziness of Downtown Dakar. Perfect hotel and very reasonable rates. Amazing views of the ocean and private little beach. Great pool as well. Staff very professional and friendly. Had a perfect stay.

utterance.kb: If you want out of the craziness of Downtown Dakar. Perfect hotel and very reasonable rates. Amazing views of the ocean and private little beach. Great pool as well. Staff very professional and friendly. Had a perfect stay.

utterance.nlg: What did the first thing I noticed was that the airconditioner was an old model?
utterance.kb: We were shown to a room and the first thing I noticed was that the airconditioner was an old model. I checked it and the vent had no spring, so cold air would head straight down onto my side of the bed. We tried another room and the same thing applied, so we opted for the first one and I put a bandaid on the aircon vent to keep it in place for the night. The room was quite OK except that we couldn't program the TV for some reason. After multiple repeats of CNN news we gave up on that. The bed was fine. We slept well, but the shower had the tiniest amount of water pressure - enough though for an adequate shower in my case. My wife opted for the bucket that was placed in the recess and showered the old-fashioned Asian way. This is not good for a supposedly 5-star hotel. Breakfast was OK. Reception was a bit offhand. The young man when we arrived didn't really want to know what I was saying. He may have been new, as when I asked later where the nearest ATM was, and he ignored me, an older man came to the rescue and was very helpful. This is really a pretty run-down hotel.
